JoJoMod@TheCoroboCorner.readme:
# JoJo Mod

This is a mod that aims to add a lot of the different Stands from JoJo's Bizarre Adventure.
Currently, there are *45* Jokers, *29* Consumables, *1* enhancement, and *1* sticker.

Textures are still incomplete for now, with most of them using placeholders, so please stay tuned for the future, and I hope you enjoy the mod!

# How to Install

You will require [Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods) in order to use this mod. Instructions on [how to install Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki) are listed on their Github page.

Once that's installed, just unzip the file called "Release.zip" into your Mods folder, and you should be good to go!

(Oh, and this mod isn't compatible with the Incantation mod; it causes some issues with one of our Jokers. I'll try to fix that in the future, but for right now, if you have both, it won't work.)

Enjoy!

Maximus@the-Astra.description: Maximus is a Vanilla+ mod that strives to preserve the Vanilla feel of the game (for the most part, looking at you Nuclear deck) while innovating on newer ideas to keep things fresh! Join the Discord: https://discord.gg/GvCCcryM48
Maximus@the-Astra.readme:
![Banner](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fa66aa30-60b8-44f9-9d41-5a452ca08b49)
Maximus is a Vanilla+ mod that strives to preserve the Vanilla feel of the game (for the most part, looking at you Nuclear deck) while innovating on newer ideas to keep things fresh!

Maximus currently adds the following:
- 150 Jokers
- 6 Decks
- 15 Achievements
- 12 Horoscope Cards
- 3 Spectral Cards
- 11 Planet Cards
- 10 Boss Blinds
- 15 Challenges
- 8 Vouchers
- AND MORE!!!

### THIS MOD DEPENDS ON [3xCredits](https://github.com/AuroraKy/3xCredits)! Please ensure you install this mod too!!

### [Official Discord](https://discord.gg/GvCCcryM48)
Join to keep up to date with development, contributions, or just to chat with people who also enjoy the mod!

### [How to install](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki)
Follow this guide and unzip the latest release of Maximus into the newly created "Mods" folder

versionHistory.name: v1.2.1
versionHistory.body:
## Additions
- 4 new Challenges (Feast Fit for a King, Coexist, Speedrun, and Greedy Bastard)
- A ton of winning/losing Quips
- Maximus now properly provides OneTooManyAPI

## Changes
- Changed all scaling methods to use SMODS' new method. Allows for cross-mod compatibility for features like Group Chat and Soil Joker
- Changed Nuclear deck from using custom code to the new SMODS Operator API. Allows for less conflicts with Nuclear Deck specifically (aka you can now use Nuke Deck with Cryptid)
- Spider Joker is no longer affected by chance modifiers
- Changed many challenges to use new challenge calculation methods for better reliability
- Changed some Horoscope tags to trigger using global mod calculate methods for better reliability
- Secret Society is no longer hardcoded and will change based on the highest and lowest ranks available
- Achievements can now be unlocked on Unlock All profiles

## Fixes
- Fixed Bones Jr being able to spawn as eternal
- Fixed a ton of Black Seal related issues
- Fixed Detective not flipping cards
- Fixed eggsplosion patch
- Fixed Aeon not having an info card for Footprint

## Installation
Unzip the `Maximus-main.zip` file in your `%Appdata%/Roaming/Balatro/mods` folder. This assumes you have already installed Steamodded. If you have not, then please follow the installation instructions for it [here.](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki)

- 2 new Jokers (Boar Bank, Spider Joker)

- Changed Conveyor Belt timings so the values it adds do not get overwritten

# Grab Bag
Grab Bag is a Balatro mod that currently adds: 
- 46 (+8) Jokers
- 3 Tarots
- 1 Spectral
- 3 Enhancements 
- 15 Boss Blinds
- 5 Showdown Boss Blinds
- and 4 Decks.

The content in this mod is supposed to feel vanilla, and I created this new content to be largely in line with the rules and design philosophy that localthunk follows when making Jokers and other content. 

## Jokers

### Rare

## Enhancements

## Shattered Jokers

Lucky-Rabbit@Trif3ctal.readme:
# Lucky Rabbit
Lucky Rabbit is a WIP Vanilla+ Balatro mod that adds new Jokers, boss blinds, a new consumable type, and more to expand upon the base game, cooked up by [Fennex](https://www.twitch.tv/mrfennex), [Trif](https://github.com/Trif3ctal), and [HarmoniousJoker](https://github.com/HarmoniousJoker). Its time to get silly!

*Note: This mod requires [Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamopollys/Steamodded/archive/refs/heads/main.zip) and [Lovely](https://github.com/ethangreen-dev/lovely-injector/releases/latest) (obviously)*

As of now, this mod adds:
- **42** fun new Jokers
- **23** new Silly consumable cards
- **3** brand-new card modifiers known as **Markings**
- **2** new Enhancements to expand your deck
- **15** upgraded and helpful Vouchers
- **5** practical Decks
- **4** skip-worthy Tags
- **11** tough new Boss Blinds
- **6** themed Friends of Jimbo-style card skins

__Feel free to check out [the in-depth mod progress spreadsheet!](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-gmJJKUTY5EP2TqhpfTXqD-P1NzQQxCRvEpoFnwK72g/edit?gid=1809378509#gid=1809378509)__

*Give us feedback or notify us of issues at [the official Balatro Discord thread!](https://discord.com/channels/1116389027176787968/1342484578236895274)*
-

CardSleeves@larswijn.name: Card Sleeves
author: Larswijn
CardSleeves@larswijn.description: Adds sleeves as modifier to decks.  See full description in-game by enabling mod or checking `descriptions.Mods.CardSleeves`.
CardSleeves@larswijn.readme:
# ![icon](assets/1x/icon.png) CardSleeves
A Steamodded+lovely Balatro Mod that adds Sleeves.

![Balatro_Card_Sleeves](Balatro_Card_Sleeves.png)

# Requirements
Requires `steamodded >= 1.0.0~ALPHA-1206c` - [link](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki).

Requires `Lovely >= 0.6.0` - [link](https://github.com/ethangreen-dev/lovely-injector). This should already be installed as part of steamodded's installation process.

# Installation
Get the latest stable version from the [Releases](https://github.com/larswijn/CardSleeves/releases/latest), then download and extract the zip.
Or use `git clone` for the latest development code, which is more up-to-date, but might be unstable.

Make sure to put the `CardSleeves` folder in the `Mods` directory, and that it is not nested.

# Features
Sleeves are run modifiers similar to decks. Any deck and sleeve can be combined.

CardSleeves adds 15 Sleeves by default, some of which have an unique and different effect when paired with their corresponding deck:
| Sleeve           | Base effect                                            | Unique effect                                                          |
|------------------|--------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Red Sleeve       | +1 discard                                             | +1 discard, -1 hand                                                    |
| Blue Sleeve      | +1 hand                                                | +1 hand, -1 discard                                                    |
| Yellow Sleeve    | +$10                                                   | Seed Money Voucher                                                     |
| Green Sleeve     | +$1 per remaining hand/discard                         | Can go up to -$2 in debt for every hand and discard                    |
| Black Sleeve     | +1 joker slot, -1 hand                                 | +1 joker slot, -1 discard                                              |
| Magic Sleeve     | Crystal Ball Voucher, 2 Fools                          | Omen Globe Voucher                                                     |
| Nebula Sleeve    | Telescope Voucher, -1 consumable slot                  | Observatory Voucher                                                    |
| Ghost Sleeve     | Spectral cards appear in shop, Hex card                | Spectrals appear more often in shop, Spectral pack size increases by 2 |
| Abandoned Sleeve | No Face Cards in starting deck                         | Face Cards never appear                                                |
| Checkered Sleeve | 26 Spades and 26 Hearts in starting deck               | Only Spades and Hearts appear                                          |
| Zodiac Sleeve    | Tarot Merchant, Planet Merchant and Overstock Vouchers | Arcana/Celestial pack size increases by 2                              |
| Painted Sleeve   | +2 hand size, -1 joker slot                            | +1 card selection limit, -1 joker slot                                 |
| Anaglyph Sleeve  | Double Tag after each Boss Blind                       | Double Tag after each Small/Big Blind                                  |
| Plasma Sleeve    | Balance chips/mult, X2 base Blind size                 | Balance prices in shop                                                 |
| Erratic Sleeve   | All ranks/suits in starting deck are randomized        | Starting Hands/Discards/Dollars/Joker slots are randomized between 3-6 |

Other mods have the ability to add their own Sleeves! Some of these mods include:
+ [Cryptid](https://github.com/MathIsFun0/Cryptid)
+ [Familiar](https://github.com/RattlingSnow353/Familiar)
+ [SDM_0's Stuff](https://github.com/SDM0/SDM_0-s-Stuff)
+ [MoreFluff](https://github.com/notmario/MoreFluff)
+ [Reverie](https://github.com/dvrp0/reverie)
+ [Pokermon](https://github.com/InertSteak/Pokermon)
+ [Buffoonery](https://github.com/pinkmaggit-hub/Buffoonery)
+ [Balatro Drafting](https://github.com/spire-winder/Balatro-Draft)
+ [Themed Jokers](https://github.com/cerloCasa/Themed-Jokers)
+ [Jimbo's Pack](https://github.com/art-muncher/Jimbo-s-Pack)
+ And more!

CardSleeves also has support for [Galdur](https://github.com/Eremel/Galdur)'s improved new run menu!

# API (for mod developers)
Any other mod can create new sleeves. See [the wiki](https://github.com/larswijn/CardSleeves/wiki) for more information.

# Credits
Big thanks to Sable for the original idea and the original art, all the cool people who helped translate, and the amazing balatro modding community for helping out with the lua code.

Any suggestions, improvements or bugs are welcome and can be submitted through Github's Issues, or on the Balatro Discord [Thread](https://discord.com/channels/1116389027176787968/1279246553931976714).

versionHistory.name: V1.8.0
versionHistory.body:
* For other mods devs (also see [API changes](https://github.com/larswijn/CardSleeves/wiki/Sleeves-API-Changes)):
  * Deprecated `shop_final_pass` context for sleeves. As far I'm aware, no mod actually used this context.
  * Refactored `Sleeve:calculate` behind the scenes to use `SMODS.get_card_areas`.
* Mod compatibility for users:
  * Bumped minimum SMODS version to 1.0.0~ALPHA-1424a (feb 2025). You should already have this.
* Localization:
  *  German by @onichama.

versionHistory.name: V1.7.8
versionHistory.body:
* Bug fixes:
  * Fixes compat with recent [SMODS#582 deck preview pages](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/pull/582) in beta-0525b or later

versionHistory.name: V1.7.7
versionHistory.body:
* New changes in v1.7.7:
  * Added  Russian localization by @EnderDrag0n and Astryder in #15 
* Changes since v1.7.6:
  * Fixed the `modify_scoring_hand` context for other mod devs (requires SMODS 0521 or later)

versionHistory.name: V1.7.5
versionHistory.body:
- Localization:
  - Added  Polish by avandemortell2137

versionHistory.name: V1.7.4
versionHistory.body:
+ Bugfixes:
  + Fixes #13 (Gold Stake sticker visual issues)
  + Yellow sleeve now has the actual word "voucher" in its description
+ Localization:
  + Updates to zh_CN
+ Future-proofing:
  + Hopefully take https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/pull/626 into account

versionHistory.name: V1.7.3
versionHistory.body:
+ Added a new option for the config that visually stacks/compress the deck when cardsleeves is installed:
  + Always stack [default]
    + Always stacks the deck closer together.
  + When using sleeve
    + Stack the deck only when using a sleeve.
    + This is the new option, as requested by @fiiibee.
  + Never stack
    + Does not stack the cards. This could result in the sleeve being stretched, and cards visually being outside the sleeve.
    + Not recommended.

versionHistory.name: V1.7.2
versionHistory.body: * Hopefully fixed sleeves getting confused about the current deck when opening the new run menu while already in a run

versionHistory.name: V1.7.1
versionHistory.body:
* For other mods devs:
  * Sleeves now properly handle returning from the `destroy_card` context
  * Removed `Sleeve:get_name()`, since it did not respect `loc_vars` key change. As far I'm aware, no mod actually used this function
* Mod compatibility:
  * If you are using [VietnameseBalatro](https://github.com/HuyTheKiller/VietnameseBalatro), please update it to avoid conflicts
  * If you are using [SauKhongHuDecks](https://github.com/HuyTheKiller/SauKhongHuDecks), please update it to avoid conflicts
  * If you are using [MoreFluff](https://github.com/notmario/MoreFluff), please update it to avoid conflicts
* Localization:
  * Vietnamese by @HuyTheKiller

versionHistory.name: V1.6.9
versionHistory.body: - Fixed green sleeve description (effect remains unchanged)

versionHistory.name: V1.6.8
versionHistory.body:
* For other mods devs:
  * Sleeves can now retrigger jokers, similar to steamodded's [1.0.0~BETA-0309b](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/commit/41bd70adc3fe4664de0cbedd9489583535114494) version letting decks retrigger jokers
* Localization:
  * Green sleeve now has the exact same phrasing as green deck

versionHistory.name: V1.6.7
versionHistory.body:
* New changes in v1.6.7:
  * Other mods' collection -> other -> sleeves should now have better visible description pop-ups
* Bug fixes since v1.6.6:
  * Fixed a bug when using Galdur, it was possible for sleeves to think you were running a different deck
* Bug fixes since v1.6.5:
  * Fix stacked nebula deck + sleeve effect

versionHistory.name: V1.6.4
versionHistory.body:
* For other mods devs (also see [API changes](https://github.com/larswijn/CardSleeves/wiki/Sleeves-API-Changes)):
  * `Sleeve:get_name` has been deprecated. Use `Sleeve:generate_ui` instead. 
  * `:apply` now takes a `sleeve` argument (currently same as self). This should not require any code changes currently.
* Content:
  * Added red deck+sleeve unique effects
  * Added blue deck+sleeve unique effects
  * Added yellow deck+sleeve unique effects
  * Added painted deck+sleeve unique effects
* Bug fixes:
  * Automatically unlock sleeves without needing to win a run first
  * Sleeve sprite no longer gets stretched when moving around the top card of the deck
  * No more error messages in collection
  * Hopefully no more `attempt to index G.GAME.viewed_back` crashes
* Localization:
  * Added traditional Chinese (thanks to Mr Clover)

versionHistory.name: V1.6.3
versionHistory.body:
* New in v1.6.3:
  * Fixed sleeve description pop-up location in game over -> new run menu
  * Fixed crash when using Cryptid's refactor branch
* Since v1.6.1 and v1.6.2:
  * Updated mod description when mod is unloaded
  * Internal changes to use metadata json file by @therealbenpai in #10 
  * Safety checks in `check_for_unlock` as reported in #9

versionHistory.name: V1.6.0
versionHistory.body:
* API-relevant changes for other mod developers:
  * If you use unlock conditions for sleeves, and it's the default "win on X deck with Y stake", you should change from stake index to stake key. See [this page](<https://github.com/larswijn/CardSleeves/wiki/Sleeves-API-Changes#v160>) for more information.
  * Sleeves now support `:calculate`. No worries if your sleeve still uses `:trigger_effect`, as I'll probably support it as long as steamodded is too.
* General changes:
  * Sleeves will now show up in other mods' Additions -> Other, as suggested by @dimserene 
  * Plasma deck + plasma sleeve now has a neat little animation for balancing the prices in the shop!
  * The in-game mod description now uses localization for some fancy effects and better readability
  * Changed CardSleeves priority `-1` -> `-10` for compatability with Gemstones
  * Bumped min steamodded version to `1.0.0~ALPHA-1206c`, and set min lovely version to `0.6.0`
* Localization:
  * Portuguese (BR) by @pinkmaggit-hub in #6, appreciate it!
* Bugfixes:
  * Plasma deck + plasma sleeve no longer balances the score twice (visual bug only)

versionHistory.name: V1.5.5
versionHistory.body:
- Steamodded compatibility change for vouchers loading (see #7) (steamodded version 1321c or higher)
- For other mod developers: finally removed `get_current_deck_name`

versionHistory.name: V1.5.4
versionHistory.body: * Bugfix: playing cards from other mods should now work properly when using the abandoned deck + sleeve combo

versionHistory.name: V1.5.3
versionHistory.body:
- Bug fixes:
  - (Galdur only) Last run button no longer changes its sleeve when selecting one without starting a run
- Localization: 
  - Changed some hard-coded strings to use localization instead
- UI: 
  - Better alignment of sleeve select with stake select in new run menu
  - Sleeve info in deck select and run info should look a bit nicer

versionHistory.name: V1.5.2
versionHistory.body:
- Fixed possible crash when switching between selecting sleeves <-> selecting deck (galdur only)
- Fixed possible crash when highlighting locked sleeves on a brand new profile

versionHistory.name: V1.5.1
versionHistory.body: + Compatibility with the latest version of steamodded ALPHA-1306a, also known as "better-calc 2.0".

versionHistory.name: V1.5.0
versionHistory.body:
+ Sprite-sheet changes (for other mod developers):
  + Sleeve sprites should be changed to have a 1px border on both sides to prevent sprite bleeding
+ General fixes:
  + Fixed sleeve sprite bleeding (no more weird green edge flicker)
+ Galdur-related changes:
  + Added controller support
  + Fixed bug where it was possible to bypass the unique effect check
  + Fixed memory leak when switching between sleeve pages
  + Fixed tooltips from appearing on locked sleeves by @jumbocarrot0 
  + Fixed unlock description of locked sleeves to properly use "???" when it includes an unknown deck to the player by @jumbocarrot0 

Big thanks to @jumbocarrot0 for helping out with most of these changes!

versionHistory.name: V1.4.8
versionHistory.body: - Fix mod incompatibility (Cryptid+Galdur) editioned decks issue (only with lovely 0.6.0 or later)

versionHistory.name: V1.4.7
versionHistory.body:
+ Localization! Big thanks to all the people that helped me translate text into other languages!
  + Chinese by Mr Clover
  + Spanish by Batolol
  + French by Miser
+ Added incompatibility with 2 month (before 13 Sep 2024) or older versions of grim<=0.9.5 due to it breaking sleeve unlocks

versionHistory.name: V1.4.6
versionHistory.body:
+ Fix suit icon issue with recent version of steamodded (ALPHA-1028b or later)
+ Fix Cryptid misprint deck compatibility issue (only with lovely 0.6.0 or later)

versionHistory.name: V1.4.5
versionHistory.body:
- If you were using Galdur, make sure to update it to [v1.1.4](https://github.com/Eremel/Galdur/releases/latest)!
- Fix crash in config menu if user did not have Galdur installed
- Fixed sleeves vibrating on selection

versionHistory.name: V1.4.4
versionHistory.body: + Fix regression with plasma sleeve's unique effect

versionHistory.name: V1.4.3
versionHistory.body:
+ Added a config option for where to show sleeve information (name + description), with 4 options:
  + Only in deck view  [default]
    + No space for sleeve sprite/mod badges
    + Also condenses the suit counter from 2x2 to 4x1 for space
  + Only in run info
    + Still has sleeve sprite/mod badges
  + Show in both
    + Sleeve info shows up in either menu for the best of both worlds
  + Hide sleeve info
    + Hides it in both menus for the minimalists

+ Fix issue with the random sleeve button when having both locked and modded sleeves

versionHistory.name: V1.4.2
versionHistory.body: + Fix HouseRules incompatibility issue

versionHistory.name: V1.4.1
versionHistory.body:
+ API-relevant changes (for developers):
  + DEPRECATION: use `CardSleeves.Sleeve.get_current_deck_key()` now for deck comparisons instead of `CardSleeves.Sleeve.get_current_deck_name()`
  + Sleeves can now be locked (using `unlocked`, `unlock_condition`, and optionally `check_for_unlock`, `locked_loc_vars`)
  + Challenges now support the `sleeve` argument (if that's something someone wants?) - still in a beta version and might have issues/bugs

+ Content changes:
  + Sleeves are now in the collection and the CardSleeves additions tab! Find them under collection/additions -> other -> sleeves
  + Sleeves now have stickers to show the highest stake you've won with them!
  + Sleeves now have badges to show which mod(s) they're from!
  + Base-game sleeves are now locked by default, and get unlocked by winning on their corresponding deck and a minimum stake
  + Added mod config option to ignore all sleeve unlock conditions. Also added a description to all config options.

+ Multiple bug fixes
  + Sleeves no longer get applied in challenges that do not define a sleeve
  + Sleeve badges now respect Steamodded no badges config option
  + Sleeve alignment now looks better when adjust deck alignment config is disabled
  + Galdur: Last run's sleeve now persists through restarting the game

JokerDisplay@nh6574.name: JokerDisplay
author: nh6574
JokerDisplay@nh6574.description: Display useful information under Jokers. Controls: Right-click or B - hide/show. Left-click or Up - collapse/expand.
JokerDisplay@nh6574.readme: # JokerDisplay for Balatro Balatro mod that displays information such as modifiers or relevant hands, ranks or suits under Jokers. ## Installation 1. Install [Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamopollys/Steamodded) [(version >1.0.0)](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki) 2. Download the [latest release](https://github.com/nh6574/JokerDisplay/releases) 3. Extract the zip file into its own folder inside your Balatro mods folder (%appdata%\Balatro\Mods) ## Usage * Right-click the display or a Joker to hide/unhide displays (or use the back button on your controller over a Joker). This will disable all calculations for that joker (in case of crashes). * Left-click the display to collapse/expand extra rows of text. (or use the up button on your controller over a Joker). * Go to Mods > JokerDisplay > Config for more options. Feel free to [open an issue](https://github.com/nh6574/JokerDisplay/issues) for suggestions or bug reports. ## Screenshots ## Mod Support This mod only supports vanilla jokers but you can add support for it in your own mod by defining how the display should look. Check out the [wiki](https://github.com/nh6574/JokerDisplay/wiki) for API documentation. | Mods with JokerDisplay support | | |---|---| | [Aikoyori's Shenanigans](https://github.com/Aikoyori/Balatro-Aikoyoris-Shenanigans) | [Baladrone](https://github.com/fantasygone/Baladrone) | | [BalatroOlympus](https://github.com/lshtech/BalatroOlympus) | [Balatro Multiplayer](https://github.com/Balatro-Multiplayer/BalatroMultiplayer) | | [Betmma Jokers](https://github.com/betmma/my_balatro_mods) | [Bird Jokers](https://github.com/JustinBanzon/Bird-Jokers) | | [Boss Jokers](https://github.com/KilledByLava/BossJokers) | [Bunco](https://github.com/Firch/Bunco) | | [Cryptid](https://github.com/MathIsFun0/Cryptid) | [D6-Jokers](https://github.com/GauntletGames-2086/D6-Jokers) | | [Diceylatro](https://nriomoder.itch.io/diceylatro) | [Emporium](https://github.com/krokshut/Emporium) | | [Friends Vs. Balatro](https://github.com/rae-vyn/FriendsVsBalatro/tree/main) | [Inscrybed Jokers](https://github.com/LunaAstraCassiopeia/LunasBalatroMods) | | [Jank Jonklers](https://github.com/spikeof2010/JankJonklers) | [Joker Evolution](https://github.com/SDM0/Joker-Evolution) | | [JamMod](https://github.com/WilsontheWolf/JamMod) | [Lobotomy Corporation](https://github.com/Mysthaps/LobotomyCorp) | | [Pampa Joker Pack](https://github.com/lshtech/balatro-pampa-joker-pack) | [Redux Arcanum](https://github.com/jumbocarrot0/Redux-Arcanum) | | [Reverie](https://github.com/dvrp0/reverie/tree/main) | [Revo's Vault](https://github.com/Cdrvo/Revos-Vault---Balatro-Mod/tree/main) | | [SDM_0's Stuff](https://github.com/SDM0/SDM_0-s-Stuff/) | [Snow-s-Mods](https://github.com/RattlingSnow353/Snow-s-Mods) | | [SpicyJokers](https://github.com/RitchieDimaria/SpicyJokers) | [The World Ends With Jimbo](https://github.com/parchmentEngineer/The-World-Ends-With-Jimbo) | | [Valkyrie](https://github.com/dainekoichi/Valkyrie-BalatroMod) | | ## Contributing This mod will probably not get any new features after 1.8, so please feel free to fork or do PRs if you feel like you can improve on this or fix any issues! Also I would appreciate if people contact me when there are updates to the game or Steamodded that break any features or add content. ### Acknowledgements Special thanks to Eremel and OppositeWolf770 for the help! And thank you to WholeHorse for the Russian localization and SDM0 for the French localization! ## Contact If you have any issues feel free to contact me on [Twitter](https://nh6574.com/), [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/nh6574.com) or Discord as nh6574 And here's my [ko-fi link](https://ko-fi.com/nh6574) if you feel especially grateful.

# JoyousSpring - Balatro Mod Adds modern Yu-Gi-Oh! cards and mechanics. ## Installation 1. Extract the zip file into its own folder inside your Balatro mods folder (%appdata%\Balatro\Mods) Make sure to check the Glossary and the Config in Main Menu > Mods > JoyousSpring Has compatibility with [JokerDisplay](https://github.com/nh6574/JokerDisplay) version >1.8.2 Check out the [Discord](https://discord.gg/Ac5FKpQCRV) for troubleshooting and chatting about the mod <3 ## Known Issues and future ideas - Still very much WIP - Extra Deck and summon material selection doesn't work properly with a controller - It hasn't been tested with other mods (other than JokerDisplay) so it might not play well with them ## Screenshots ## Currently implemented ||||||| |--|--|--|--|--|--| |

## What's Changed
This update requires [SMODS~BETA-0827b or higher](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/releases/latest)

v0.8.5.4:
* Fix crash when calculating excavations at end of run

v0.8.4.3:
* Added JokerDisplay support for Fortune Ladies and Free Agents

v0.8.4.2:
* Some tooltips have been added or rewritten

v0.8.4.1:
* Cardian Synchros and Fortune Lady Every can be summoned without space
* Fix Super Koi Koi not working with Telescope
* Fix cards that add to the Extra Deck when used as material counting the summoned cards when checking for room

v0.8.4:
* Added Linkslayer @ Ignister, Linkslayer and Code Igniter
* Added alt arts (check config) and updated some cards that were using scans
* Added text when trying to summon an extra deck joker without space

### Installation
* Install/update [Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki)
* Delete your previous JoyousSpring files if any
* Download "Source Code (zip)" and unzip it into a folder inside your Balatro mods folder (%appdata%\Balatro\Mods)

# Recommended mods:
## Mods with native support:
* [JokerDisplay](https://github.com/nh6574/JokerDisplay) - Adds information under Jokers so you don't have to hover them. This mod adds native support.
* [TheFamily](https://github.com/SleepyG11/TheFamilyBalatro) - Adds extra tabs to the side to save space on the screen. This mod adds native support (might add exclusive features in the future so it's recommended)
* [CardSleeves](https://github.com/larswijn/CardSleeves) - Adds sleeves to decks for extra effects. This mod adds some.
* [Handy](https://github.com/SleepyG11/HandyBalatro) - Adds QoL controls to the game. This mods supports some features natively.
* [Unjankify](https://github.com/blazingulag/Unjankify) - Fixes some issues when playing with multiple mods like cardarea overlap. Includes JoyousSpring support.

## Other mods:
* [Galdur](https://github.com/Eremel/Galdur) - Nicer deck selection (Highly Recommended)
* [Glue](https://github.com/icyethics/Glue-For-Modpacks) - Utility to change shop slots, joker and consumable slots and rates
* [Cartomancer](https://github.com/stupxd/Cartomancer) - Includes functionalities to help in runs with lots of cards either in the Joker area or Deck, alongside other QoL features
* [Overflow](https://github.com/lord-ruby/Overflow) - Stacks consumables
* [Banner](https://github.com/SylviBlossom/Banner) - Ban objects from appearing in a run
* [Better Tags](https://github.com/WaffleDevs/BetterTags) - Stacks Tags
* [DebugPlus](https://github.com/WilsontheWolf/DebugPlus) - Debug/Cheating tools. Useful even if you're not a developer to bypass crashes or give yourself some items to test

* Implemented: Ghoti - the banish mechanics can keep cards off your inventory during the shop so you have more space
* Implemented: PSY-Frame - A Psychic soldier that rides into battle against the Security Forces on currents of lightning, using an autonomic amplifier called "PSY-Frame"
* Implemented: Runick, who use Tarot cards to fusion summon and can replenish them quickly at the cost of the cards in your deck
* Also many bug fixes and slight ability tweaks

### Installation
* Install/update [Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamopollys/Steamodded)
* Delete your previous JoyousSpring files if any
* Download "Source Code (zip)" and unzip it into a folder inside your Balatro mods folder (%appdata%\Balatro\Mods)

SystemClock@Breezebuilder.name: SystemClock
author: Breezebuilder
SystemClock@Breezebuilder.description: Shows the local time in-game. Don't fall into the Black Hole.
SystemClock@Breezebuilder.readme:
# SystemClock for Balatro

   

SystemClock is a mod for [Balatro](https://store.steampowered.com/app/2379780/Balatro/) which adds a draggable, resizable, customizable clock to the game screen. It includes 5 editable presets and supports a variety of time formats, UI styles, and color options. Keep track of time - don't fall into the `Black Hole`. ## Installation 1. Install [Lovely](https://github.com/ethangreen-dev/lovely-injector/releases) by following the [installation instructions here](https://github.com/ethangreen-dev/lovely-injector?tab=readme-ov-file#manual-installation). - On **Windows**, `version.dll` should be in the same folder as `Balatro.exe` - On **macOS**, `liblovely.dylib` should be in the same folder as `Balatro.app` 2. Open the **Mods** folder or create one if it does not exist. - On **Windows** this should be located at `%AppData%/Balatro/Mods` - On **macOS** this should be located at `/Users/$USER/Library/Application Support/Balatro/Mods` 3. **Install SystemClock** by copying the **SystemClock** folder **from inside** [SystemClock-version.zip](https://github.com/Breezebuilder/SystemClock/releases) into the **Mods** folder. 4. **Configure SystemClock** to your liking by **right-clicking** on the clock - With only Lovely installed, this menu can also be found at **Settings** -> **Clock** - If [Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods) is also installed, this menu can be found at **MODS** -> **SystemClock** -> **Config** tab ## Contribute Have an idea for a feature? Found a bug? [Create an issue here](https://github.com/Breezebuilder/SystemClock/issues/)

BalatroBakery@BakersDozenBagels.name: Bakery
author: BakersDozenBagels
BalatroBakery@BakersDozenBagels.readme:
# Bakery

A mod for [Balatro](https://www.playbalatro.com/) that adds various miscellaneous things, created by BakersDozenBagels.

Additions are generally meant to be well-balanced with vanilla, although the decks are a bit wackier.

Current contents:

- 22 Jokers
- 10 Charms (a new kind of thing in the shop)
- 20 Tags
- 3 Decks
- 3 [Deck Sleeves](https://github.com/larswijn/CardSleeves)
- 5 Blinds
- 3 Challenges
- 1 Tarot Card
- 2 Spectral Cards
- 2 Enhancements
- 1 Edition
- Miscellaneous modding API features (If this mod does something interesting, it can probably be used as a dependency to do that thing)

## Cross-Mod Content

With certain other mods installed, Bakery will add extra items:
- [Revo's Vault](https://github.com/Cdrvo/Revos-Vault---Balatro-Mod) - 1 Charm
- [MoreFluff](https://github.com/notmario/MoreFluff) - 1 Charm
- [Cryptid](https://github.com/SpectralPack/Cryptid) - 2 Charms

## Installation

1. Bakery requires [Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods). Follow the instructions to install it if you haven't already.
2. Clone this repository into your mods folder, or download it as a zip and place it there.
3. Enjoy!

## Lite Version

If another mod depends on Bakery, but you do not want Bakery's additions, you can install the [lite version](https://github.com/BakersDozenBagels/BalatroBakery/tree/lite). This version only has a modding API and nothing else. Note that both versions can be installed together without issue so long as both are up-to-date.

## Other Contributors

Thanks to GhostSalt (@ghost12salt) and SadCube (@sadcube) on Discord for some of the artwork used.

Balatest@BakersDozenBagels.name: Balatest
author: BakersDozenBagels
Balatest@BakersDozenBagels.readme:
# Balatest - Unit Testing for Balatro

Balatest is a unit testing framework for Balatro mods. See [Bakery's unit tests](https://github.com/BakersDozenBagels/BalatroBakery/tree/main/test) for example code using Balatest.

## How To Use

First, register some unit tests with `Balatest.TestPlay` (see below). Then, to run tests, execute `Balatest.run_tests()` (I recommend using [DebugPlus](https://github.com/WilsontheWolf/DebugPlus) to do so). Balatest will put test results in the console/log. You can also only run the tests from a given mod (`Balatest.run_tests 'Bakery'`) or from a category in a mod (`Balatest.run_tests('Bakery', 'blinds')`).

## Writing Tests

A test in Balatest is fundamentally a [challenge](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki/SMODS.Challenge). Many of the keys in a challenge will also work in a test. Balatest will automatically begin the challenge and navigate to the Small Blind (note that every blind is Small by default). From there, `test.execute()` is called, where you will play, discard, navigate rounds, etc. Finally, `test.assert()` is called to evaluate the results of the test.

### `execute`

Here you will put some actions in a queue to set up the test. Note that this queue is *not* the default one; use `Balatest.q()` to add to it (`q` accepts bare functions as well as `Event`s for added convenience. Additionally, it will automatically `return true` for you unless you explicitly `return false`).

Balatest also provides some pre-built events for you (each of these adds to the queue for you):
- `Balatest.next_round()` ends the round and navigates to the next one.
- `Balatest.end_round()` ends the round and waits on the evaluation screen.
- `Balatest.cash_out()` cashes out the round evaluation screen.
- `Balatest.exit_shop()` exits the shop.
- `Balatest.start_round()` selects the next blind.
- `Balatest.skip_blind(for_tag)` skips the next blind for the given tag (by key).
- `Balatest.play_hand { '2S', '10H' }` plays those cards in that order. Note that this fails if the cards are not in hand.
- `Balatest.discard { 'Ts', 'Qc' }` discards those cards. Note that this fails if the cards are not in hand.
- `Balatest.highlight { '2S', '10H' }` highlights those cards in that order. Note that this fails if the cards are not in hand.
- `Balatest.unhighlight_all()` unhighlights the hand.
- `Balatest.use(card, instant)` uses a consumable. E.g. `Balatest.use(G.consumeables.cards[1])` (you can also pass a function as in `buy`)
- `Balatest.buy(func)` buys something from the shop. E.g. `Balatest.buy(function() return G.shop_jokers.cards[1] end)`
- `Balatest.hook(obj, name, func)` hooks a function until the test concludes. See below for more information.
- `Balatest.hook_raw(obj, name, new)` overwrites an object until the test concludes.
- `Balatest.wait_for_input(state, front)` waits until the game will accept input.
- `Balatest.reload()` saves and loads the game as if by returning to the main menu.
- `Balatest.wait()` waits until everything currently in the standard event queue completes.

### `assert`

Here you will write some assertions on the final state of the test. Balatest provides a few helpers for this:
- `Balatest.assert(bool, message?)` is a bare assertion.
- `Balatest.assert_eq(a, b, message?)` asserts that two numbers are equal with or without Talisman.
- `Balatest.assert_neq(a, b, message?)` asserts that two numbers are unequal with or without Talisman.
- `Balatest.assert_chips(num, message?)` asserts that `G.GAME.chips` is equal to the supplied number.

## Example Test

```lua
Balatest.TestPlay {
    jokers = { 'j_joker' }, -- Start with a Joker
    execute = function()
        Balatest.play_hand { '2S' } -- Play a High Card
    end,
    assert = function()
        Balatest.assert_chips(35) -- Total round score, *not* the last hand
    end
}
```

## Default Values

Balatest will run each test with the following defaults:
- `back = 'Red Deck'`
- `stake = 1`
- `seed = nil`
- `jokers = {}`
- `consumeables = {}`
- `vouchers = {}`
- `dollars = 0` (Starting money)
- `discards = 999`
- `hands = 999`
- `hand_size = 52`
- `modifiers = {}` (`challenge.rules.modifiers`)
- `custom = {}` (`challenge.rules.custom`)
- `deck = nil`
- `blind = 'bl_small'`
- `no_auto_start = false`

# Advanced Features

- Specify `blind = 'bl_wheel'` to make every blind The Wheel. By default, every blind is a Small Blind.
- Specify `name = 'something'` to give your test a descriptive name. Names are automatically prefixed with your mod's ID.
- Specify `category = 'my_category'` to be able to run a subset of your tests. You can specify multiple categories in a table.
- Use `Balatest.run_test { ... }` to run a single test not defined elsewhere.
- Use `Balatest.run_test 'mod_id_test_name'` to run a single test.
- Check `Balatest.current_test` for the name of the currently running test.
- Check `Balatest.current_test_object` for the whole config of the currently running test.
- Inspect `Balatest.done` for more detailed results of your tests.

## `Balatest.hook`

Sometimes it's necessary to hook a function in the middle of a test, for example to control RNG.
Balatest provides a fixture to do this and automatically unhook the functions later.

Consider the following quite silly test:

```lua
Balatest.run_test {
    consumeables = { 'c_judgement' },
    execute = function()
        Balatest.hook(_G, 'create_card', function(orig, t, a, l, r, k, s, forced_key, ...)
            return orig(t, a, l, r, k, s, 'j_chicot', ...)
        end)
        Balatest.use(G.consumeables.cards[1])
    end,
    assert = function()
        Balatest.assert_eq(#G.consumeables.cards, 0)
        Balatest.assert_eq(#G.jokers.cards, 1)
        Balatest.assert(G.jokers.cards[1].config.center.key == 'j_chicot')
    end
}
```

Here, we force the global function `create_card` to create a Chicot (which otherwise cannot spawn from Judgement).
Note that the first argument to the new function is the previous function.

```lua
Balatest.run_test {
    consumeables = { 'c_judgement', 'c_judgement' },
    execute = function()
        Balatest.hook(_G, 'create_card', function(orig, t, a, l, r, k, s, forced_key, ...)
            return orig(t, a, l, r, k, s, 'j_perkeo', ...)
        end)
        Balatest.use(G.consumeables.cards[1])
        Balatest.hook(_G, 'create_card', function(orig, t, a, l, r, k, s, forced_key, ...)
            return orig(t, a, l, r, k, s, 'j_caino', ...)
        end)
        Balatest.use(G.consumeables.cards[2]) -- The card is looked up before the other one gets destroyed.
    end,
    assert = function()
        Balatest.assert_eq(#G.consumeables.cards, 0)
        Balatest.assert_eq(#G.jokers.cards, 2)
        Balatest.assert(G.jokers.cards[1].config.center.key == 'j_perkeo')
        Balatest.assert(G.jokers.cards[2].config.center.key == 'j_caino')
    end
}
```

Here, we hook the same function twice. Note that when the second hook is applied, the first hook gets removed.
Also note that the application of the hook is queued.
After running these tests, even if they fail, the function will be what it was originally.

LobotomyCorp@Mysthaps.name: Lobotomy Corporation
author: Mysthaps
LobotomyCorp@Mysthaps.description: Face the Fear, Build the Future.
LobotomyCorp@Mysthaps.readme:
Lobotomy Corporation

Face the Fear, Build the Future.

Greetings, Manager. I see that you've been slacking off while playing a few rounds of cards during our work hours. I am unfamiliar with playing cards myself, but I am able to modify this little game of yours so that you can still have "fun" while still generating precious energy to meet the daily quota. This may hinder your playing experience, but I am sure you will do just fine.
# Notice **Lobotomy Corporation** is about discovery and experiment with different Abnormalities. It is recommended to play with **Lobotomy Corporation** by itself on your first playthrough, regardless of this mod's cross-mod content. The **Discover All** functionality does not discover Abnormalities from this mod, since it can be overwhelming for new players with the amount of text each Abnormality has. # Features ## Abnormalities, as Jokers Each added Abnormality have different Observation Levels that unlock more of their Information. This is based on the amount of rounds played with that Abnormality in your Joker slots. ## Abnormalities, as Boss Blinds Some Abnormalities are able to ***breach***. In addition, some breaching Abnormalities can change the upcoming fights to be an Abnormality as a Boss Blind. These blinds are very hard to take down, make sure you're well-prepared before tackling on these challenges. ## Extraction Pack To help with discovering Abnormalities, a new **Booster Pack** type is added. This pack allows you to pick one of three Abnormalities to add to your Joker slots. ## Ordeals During the run, **Ordeals** can replace some blinds. These blinds are generally more difficult to take down compared to the other blinds, with **Dawn Ordeals** being the easiest, and **Midnight Ordeals** being much a lot tougher to overcome. ## Challenges In some Challenges, Ordeals are guaranteed to appear. In others, you might be fighting **[[[INFORMATION REDACTED]]]**. Good luck, Manager. You will need it.
Lobotomy Corporation Spoilers There are challenges that mirror the Sephirah Meltdowns experienced in the main game. It is recommended that they should be experienced in the actual game before attempting them here.

# Requirements Requires the latest version of **Steamodded** 1.0.0-ALPHA. Instructions can be found [here](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki). # Installation Head to the mod's *[Releases](https://github.com/Mysthaps/LobotomyCorp/releases/latest)* page and download the latest version. You can also *clone* this repository, however, some things may break. Make sure that the mod folder is not nested (your folder is **not** ``Mods\LobotomyCorp\LobotomyCorp\...`` or similar). Please check the mod's configurations after installation. # Credits ### **[Lobotomy Corporation](https://store.steampowered.com/app/568220/Lobotomy_Corporation__Monster_Management_Simulation/)** ### **[Library of Ruina](https://store.steampowered.com/app/1256670/Library_Of_Ruina/)** ### **[Limbus Company](https://store.steampowered.com/app/1973530/Limbus_Company/)** All music used are listed in the ``music.txt`` file, found [here](https://github.com/Mysthaps/LobotomyCorp/blob/main/music.txt). Other credits can be found in the **Credits** tab in the mod's menu

versionHistory.name: 1.4.0d
versionHistory.body:
# Please make sure your **Steamodded** version is at least ``1.0.0~BETA-1016c``!
(The last four numbers correspond to the release date of the Steamodded version. If your version's number is lower, please update.)

# Changelog Summary
## 1.4.0d
- Balance change: 1.76 MHz now favors lower values
- Fixed Firebird crashing with Talisman, again
- Fixed Spider Bud not updating first discard after beating a Boss Blind (thanks @wingedcatgirl!)
- Fixed a typo making Little Red Riding Hooded Mercenary crash when hovered
- Fixed a crash when a destroyed card gets debuffed
- Fixed modifier sprites showing when card is faced down
- Fixed Abnormality Screen Text and Lyrics acting strangely when the game is paused or when GasHarpoon changes phases
- Fixed Shield for GasHarpoon not working
- Tried fixing The Servant of Wrath crashing when hovered
- Minor changes for Mobile (thanks @a2639443196!)
## 1.4.0c
- Fixed crash with Big and Will be Bad Wolf
- Fixed Firebird crashing with Talisman
## 1.4.0b
- Fixed a crash when Apocalypse Bird calculates score
- Fixed the background not changing for Apocalypse Bird's early phases
## 1.4.0
### New Content
- Added 2 new Abnormality Blinds: Hatred, Hermit
- Added Chinese localization by @a2639443196 
### Balance Changes
- Updated sticker compatibility
- Plague Doctor: Cost $4 > $6
- Laetitia: No longer compatible with Blueprint
- The Firebird: Money threshold $3 > $5
### Bug Fixes & Improvements
- Added flavor text and made the Boss Blind automatically reroll when an Abnormality breaches, and the Abnormality Blind is available
- Updated the descriptions of several Abnormalities
- Removed conflict with the "3xCredits" mod
- Fixed several Abnormalities displaying extra scoring messages

The full changelog can be found here:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eHInr9F44KQo7p8mbNmKRjMfPOJ6sG6sJOsDXip-UEE/edit?usp=sharing

# Installation
Install **Steamodded** here: https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki
Then, download the mod by pressing the **Source code (zip)** button below.

versionHistory.name: Version 1.0.0 release
versionHistory.body:
This mod currently just adds four new mechanics to the game of Balatro:

1. It allows you to **lock** and **unlock** your Jokers and Consumeables at will, so that you don't accidentally sell anything.
2. It allows you to play the **last hand** you played at the click of a button (if it's possible to play it, of course).
3. It adds a **health-bar** mechanic. You start at 100 HP. If you lose a round, the percentage left you had to beat is subtracted from your HP. When your HP reaches zero, you lose. Simple as that!
4. It also adds a **hold** mechanic. At any time, you can hold up to five cards in your offhand, swapping them with whatever cards from your hand that you choose. Be careful though -- cards in your offhand don't trigger their "held in hand" effects, and can't be played unless they're swapped back into your main hand. 

In the future, boss blinds and more fun mechanics are intended to be added, so stay tuned for what's next!

List of Jokers (Modded Wiki Page): https://balatromods.miraheze.org/wiki/Pi_cubed's_Jokers/Jokers

Documentation spreadsheet (Planned content, patch notes, & more info): https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1s2MFswjKUeVcx3W0Cylmya1ZfFvx2fiQZD42ZThxd5Q/edit?usp=sharing

Discord discussion thread: https://discord.com/channels/1116389027176787968/1348621804696240201

pi_cubed's Jokers is a lightweight mod with minimal lovely patching and hooks. As a result, there should be few crashes due to conflicts with other mods.

## Recommended Mods
### Partner by baimao  
pi_cubed's Jokers adds 4 new Partners!  
https://github.com/Icecanno/Partner-API  

### Opandora's Box by opan 
A Joker pack I really enjoy with some interesting synergies, and stellar music.  
https://github.com/ohpahn/opandoras-box

### Extra Credit by CampfireCollective & more  
https://github.com/GuilloryCraft/ExtraCredit

### Neato Jokers by NEATO  
https://github.com/neatoqueen/NeatoJokers

### Paperback by PaperMoon, OppositeWolf770, srockw, GitNether, Victin, BBBalatroMod, & more  
The Bisexual Flag Joker is compatible with additional suits.  
https://github.com/GitNether/paperback

### Cryptid by MathIsFun_ & many more  
There's some hidden content that requires Cryptid. In addition, I've put a big focus on making sure the changing value mechanics and Misprintize behave properly with all Jokers!  
https://github.com/SpectralPack/Cryptid

## Config Options
A game restart is required for Config options to take effect.

### New Spectral Cards  
This option enables or disables the Spectral Cards Commander, Rupture, and Extinction from appearing.

### Preorder Bonus' Hook  
Turn this option off to rework the Joker's mechanics very slightly to remove its hook that I (very jankily) implemented. This option may be useful if you're experiencing conflicts regarding setting the cost of Booster Packs.

### Custom Sound Effects  
Enables or disables any custom sound effects I've implemented into the mod. Currently, this affects Rhythmic Joker, Explosher, On-beat, Off-beat, Pot, and Talking Flower.

versionHistory.body:
Hey, uh, why did I very discretely increment the main version number? Well, there was one (1) mod manager that thought my BETA releases were more recent than the post-beta releases due to it ignoring the "beta" in the releases' tags.

- Tyre Dumpyard costs $5 -> $4

- Weighted Die costs $5 -> $4
- Super Wrathful Joker only activates if played hand has 4 scored cards or less
- Pot gives X4 -> X3 Mult
- Forgery gives half -> a quarter of chips as Mult
- Forgery costs $6 -> $7
- Missing Finger gives X4 Mult -> X3 Mult
- Missing Finger costs $7 -> $9
- Hierarchy gives X2 -> X1.5 Mult
- Satanist costs $5 -> $6
- The Cube gives $ equal to rank -> half rank
- Fixed Sprinkler to no longer crash if a suit has no cards remaining in the deck

Changes:

- Sprinkler fixed to no longer switch chosen suit when bought if there is a tie amongst the most common suit (in addition, Sprinkler fallback suit changed to Clubs)
- Landslide activation animation tweaked
- Fixed cards remaining to appear rankless after having been removed of their Stone enhancement that was applied by Landslide
- Forgery fixed to no longer attempt to destroy a card that another copy of Forgery has already destroyed
- Forgery fixed to not activate if no (valid) cards are remaining in the deck
- Fixed an issue where the number of cards selected can for a moment exceed the selection limit - if a Missing Finger is obtained whilst more cards are selected than the new selection limit, all cards are now deselected

Changes:
- Added 1 new tag
- Added 1 new sticker
- Added 1 new deck
- Added CardSleeves support for all decks
- Boomerang costs $6 -> $4
- Rejuvenation Deck and Nostalgic Rejuvination Deck Challenge Deck now have cleaner "+1 Joker Slot" UI (code copied from Ortalab)
- Fixed Rejuvenation Deck giving Joker slots too early if the Deck is selected on consecutive runs
- Tweaked Rejuvenation Deck description
- Fixed Joker in a Nutshell to be able to count the lines of descriptions with multiboxes
- Ambigram UI Button fixed to now be able to coexist with the sell button
- When Ambigram is used, cards will now be changed in order from left to right rather than the order of selection
- Ambigram can no longer be "used" if no 6s or 9s are selected
- Ambigram fixed to no longer change the base rank of Stone cards
- Rupture fixed to no longer destroy eternal Jokers that do not explicitly have the Eternal sticker (i.e. modded Eternal-likes)

Changes:
- Tweaked Incomplete Survey description
- Blueberry Pie added to "Food" pool
- Fixed Monkey See, Monkey Do being able to select the same rank twice

Changes:
- Added 5 new jokers

  - 4 Uncommon

- Joker Circuit costs $6 -> $4
- All In retriggers played cards 2 additional times, and retriggers held cards and Jokers 1 additional time
- Various jokers will no longer upgrade multiple times at once due to being retriggered by All In or other joker retriggerers
- Some Jokers now have multiple description boxes to better communicate having multiple effects (Stonemason, All In, Extra Limb, Polyrhythm, Off the Hook, and Round-a-bout)
- Fixed the Nostalgic Rejuvination Deck Challenge to properly add Joker slots and replace the first Buffoon pack with a Mega Celestial Pack

toomanyjokers@cg-223.name: Too Many Jokers
author: cg
toomanyjokers@cg-223.description: Adds a filtering system to the Joker collection.
toomanyjokers@cg-223.readme:
# Too Many Jokers
Adds a toggleable sidebar displaying your collection, along with a searchbar.

## Usage
Press T to open TMJ on your left.

At the bottom is a text input for searching. Searches are loosely matched against every card. If a card doesn't match your search terms, it won't be displayed.

You can use multiple search terms using commas. All provided search terms must match with a card for the card to show. (e.g. `+mult, xmult` will only show jokers that give both xmult and +mult, not any joker that gives either)

## Advanced uses

There are several special search terms, surrounded by braces (`{}`). These allow you to specify more about your search. They MUST come before any normal search terms.

## `{any}`

{any} specifies that if ANY of the search terms are matched, a card will show up. Using the example above, `{any}, +mult, xmult` will show jokers that give either +mult or xmult.

## `{regex}`

{regex} specifies that we should use Lua's pattern matcher instead of just a raw search. Keep in mind this is Lua patterns, not actual regex.

## `{edition:modprefix_editionkey}`

{edition} will apply the specified edition to all cards in TMJ. This is useful for mod developers making shaders that want to see how their shader looks on various (or specific) jokers.

## `{ace:<lua code here>}`

{ace} will run the lua code as the block of a function (or just a single expression e.g. `center.pools.Kitties`, or in the case of a full function body `if center.pools.Kitties then return true end`) given the argument of `center`. If it returns `false`, `nil`, or errors (which will be caught), then the center passed into the function will not show in TMJ.

It is okay for the function given to error, it will be treated as if the function returned false.

This is helpful for... uh.... uhm.... idk but it's cool right?

## `!`
Any non-special search term can be prefixed with `!` to specify that you want to negate that search term (so if it IS matched, do not show the card)

Credits to Dimserene for the idea to create this mod.

versionHistory.name: v4.8.1
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:
- Dragged cards in TMJ now display overtop the UI
- `{edition:<modprefix_key>}` added as a special command to apply a certain edition to all cards in TMJ
- `{ace:<lua code>}` added as a special command to return `true` if a card should be included in the search result, given a `center` as an argument. An error being thrown or anything other than `true` being returned means that center will not be shown in TMJ
- Fix banner compatibility (thanks to ejwu)
- Add config option to disable automatically focusing the TMJ textbox when you type
- Add config option to show ALL cards in TMJ, regardless of whether they are no_collection
- Fix a small issue where G.TMJTAGS wasn't set to nil
- Support trackpads better by not reloading TMJ when you haven't scrolled enough to make a difference in the cards being shown
- Add config option to increase/decrease the sensitivity of your scrolling
- (v4.8.1) Fix configs not saving sometimes

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/cg-223/toomanyjokers/compare/v4.7.3...v4.8.1

versionHistory.name: v4.7.3
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:
- Compatibility fixes


NOTE: There's a bug in this release where TMJ doesn't work unless you have [DebugPlus](https://github.com/WilsontheWolf/DebugPlus) installed. If you want to use TMJ without debugplus, use the latest commit instead of this release.

versionHistory.name: v4.7.2
versionHistory.body:
- New method of resolving set names, now uses localized names instead of keys
- Compatibility with Handy
- Changed to MIT License (from no license at all)
- Now has a proper steamodded dependency, instead of just crashing when TMJ is opened on an unsupported version
- Cards in TMJ no longer "jiggle"
- Shift-clicking special mod tags in TMJ now takes you to that mods config
- Config handler updated
- New config to show all mod tags in TMJ, including those with no found objects
- Fix error caused by centers that don't have a set

**Code Changes**: https://github.com/cg-223/toomanyjokers/compare/4.6.1...v4.7.1

Notable changes:
- New bar to the right of TMJ: You can click on mod tags to view all the items from that mod
- Scrolling can now be done via arrow keys (you must enable this in your config)
- - If you hold lctrl (or rctrl) while pressing an arrow key, a full page will be scrolled (regardless of the full-page config option)
- - Holding the arrow keys will allow you to scroll faster
- TMJ now properly overlays on top of things like card areas.
- When you close TMJ, the search will be reset when it is reopened.

**Code Changes**: https://github.com/cg-223/toomanyjokers/compare/v4.5.2...4.6.1

versionHistory.name: v4.5.2
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:
- You can now automatically create the first joker that appears for a given search by holding ctrl when you press enter to finalize a search. This will also close TMJ after creating the joker. You can disable this behavior in the TMJ mod settings. This feature is only enabled when debug mode is on (usually done by installing DebugPlus)
- If the close-on-escape config option is enabled, TMJ will not automatically close when you press T (only when you press escape). This means you can press T to autofocus the search bar and begin typing a search that starts with T
- The textbox will no longer autofocus when you press a number key. This means that you can perform certain actions (e.g. using the debug 1/2/3 keys to unlock/discover/spawn a card) without causing the textbox to become focused.

versionHistory.name: v4.4.1
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:
- Duplicates no longer appear for cards that are in multiple pools
- Potentially fix a bug causing a crash in the normal collection

versionHistory.name: v4.3.3
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:
- Fix a crossmod crash when TMJ is opened

versionHistory.name: v4.3.2
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes

versionHistory.name: v4.3.1
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:

versionHistory.name: v4.3.0
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:
- Make the game launch

versionHistory.name: v4.1.0
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:
- Config option to close TMJ when esc is pressed
- Config option to scroll TMJ by a full page at a time instead of one row at a time
- Visual indicator for pinned cards
- Several bug fixes

versionHistory.name: v4.0.0
versionHistory.body:
Notable changes:
- Mod has been rewritten from the ground up, with very few bits of code copied from v3
- Support for features added by other mods has been moved to an API and is no longer done by me, mod devs that add features of centers  check api.md to see how to implement support.
- You can no longer scroll out of bounds upwards
- Config has been improved, now uses three labeled text inputs instead of one text input and an option cycle
- Search bar is no longer automatically selected based on a config option, instead it will auto select if you begin typing as the UI is open. Exclusions are in place for the T key (to close the UI) and special keys like control, alt, shift
- Better performance, so TMJ should be much faster with thousands of jokers (as the name would suggest)
- Code in general is much cleaner, so future improvements will be much easier

CoroboUtils@TheCoroboCorner.name: CoroboUtils
author: TheCoroboCorner
CoroboUtils@TheCoroboCorner.description: Just adds a bunch of QoL functions for modding. Shouldn't do anything on its own.

versionHistory.name: New: Conversion Systems, Event Manager
versionHistory.body:
This version has two new additions: conversion systems and an event manager.

With the conversion system, you can set up unit-exchange systems that have arbitrary units/axes and numeric values. This can be used for things such as currency conversion. That is, if your mod adds a set of currencies that have some sort of an exchange rate, you can implement that exchange rate in this system and avoid all of the trouble that comes with doing that.

With the event manager, you no longer need to create dummy CardAreas and dummy Jokers just to be able to activate functions in a specific context; you can just set up an event and let the event manager handle it all. In addition, it supports prioritization, as well as single-use/persistent events, so it should have maximum versatility in the areas it's needed.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/TheCoroboCorner/CoroboUtils/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0

versionHistory.name: Initial Release
versionHistory.body:
There are four main functions/systems provided in this release:

1. You can create aliases for functions and variables. You simply register an alias in the system with `CUTIL.alias`, then you can either access the aliased function directly with `CUTIL.aliases`, or you can use `CUTIL.resolve_alias` to fetch it in a safer manner.
2. There is a variable/modifier system. Instead of having to register all your game variables directly in G.GAME, you can now just call `CUTIL.add_variable` and it will sort out everything for you. Similarly, for when you want to modify the variable, you can now just call `CUTIL.add_modifier`, targeting the specific variable and modifying it however you wish.
3. You can work with numeric field extensions -- that is, take for example you wanted to work with the complex numbers. You can then use `CUTIL.FieldExtension.wrap({1, 0, 1}), as that defines x such that 1 + 0x + 1x^2 = 0, which is exactly how i works in the complex numbers.
4. Tweening and Bezier curves have been added. You can either construct a curve explicitly with `CUTIL.Tween.make_bezier` or `CUTIL.Tween.create`, or you can use one of the provided presets. This can be used to make things a lot smoother.

In addition to this, various miscellaneous functions have been added and documentation is provided in the code.

# N's Repertorium - Balatro Mod

Adds stuff.

Better enjoyed with [Blockbuster: Counters](https://github.com/icyethics/Blockbuster-Counters). Also features [Balatro Goes Kino](https://github.com/icyethics/Kino) crossmod.

## Installation

1. Install [Steamodded](https://github.com/Steamopollys/Steamodded) [(version >1.0.0)](https://github.com/Steamodded/smods/wiki)
2. Download the [latest release](https://github.com/nh6574/JoyousSpring/releases)
3. Extract the zip file into its own folder inside your Balatro mods folder (%appdata%\Balatro\Mods)

## Contact

If you have any issues feel free to contact me on [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/nh6574.com) or [on the official Balatro Discord as nh6574](https://discord.com/invite/balatro)

And here's my [ko-fi link](https://ko-fi.com/nh6574) if you feel especially grateful.

Also check out my Quality of Life mod [JokerDisplay](https://github.com/nh6574/JokerDisplay)!

# CryptLib
CryptLib is a mod that provides helper functionality otherwise only accesible by depending on Cryptid
This includes:
* Gameset config and disabling arbitrary content (opt-in)
* Value Manipulation
* Forcetrigging including Vanilla support
* Pluralisation for card descriptions
* Talisman independant ^mult & ^chips if Talisman isnt present
* Function definitions for to_big, to_number and lenient_bignum incase Talisman isnt present
* Various other utility functions
